properties.title: Tinguely Fountain
properties.abstract: In the place where the stage of the old City Theatre formerly stood, in 1977 Jean Tinguely placed amusing machine sculptures in an enormous pool of water.
properties.description:
In a shallow pool 19 cm deep, 16 m wide and 19 m long, cast in black mastic asphalt the artist placed nine black figures driven by low-voltage current that spout water as they move. These nine iron eminences cheerfully converse with one another like the mimes, actors and dancers once did on the stage at this exact spot.

With this fountain the popular artist endowed Basel with a new landmark. Regardless of the weather, the fountain site is always thronged with people being animated to picnic or moved to strike up a conversation with a stranger. This work of art has become part of the life of Baselâ€™s inhabitants in a way few other objects have.
